\n RecordType\n.description: Indicates whether record is an individual constituent ("Individual") or an organization ("Organization")

\n City\n.value: The city for the billing address.
\n City\n.description: The city for the billing address.

\n Country\n.value: The 2-letter country code as specified by ISO-3166-1.
\n Country\n.description: The 2-letter country code as specified by ISO-3166-1.

\n Email\n.value: The email address associated with the billing address.
\n Email\n.description: The email address associated with the billing address.

\n Line\n.value: The address line for the billing address. Typically a street address, but may also be a post office box, or the like.
\n Line\n.description: The address line for the billing address. Typically a street address, but may also be a post office box, or the like.

\n Phone\n.value: The phone number associated with the billing address.
\n Phone\n.description: The phone number associated with the billing address.

\n PostCode\n.value: The post code of the billing address.
\n PostCode\n.description: The post code of the billing address.

\n State\n.value: The 2-letter(or in some rare cases 3-letter) country subdivision(generally a state or province) code state/province as specified by ISO-3166-2.
\n State\n.description: The 2-letter(or in some rare cases 3-letter) country subdivision(generally a state or province) code state/province as specified by ISO-3166-2.

\n Message\n.value: The Message if the transaction was not initiated successfully.
\n Message\n.description: The Message if the transaction was not initiated successfully.

\n ProcessURI\n.value: If the transaction was successfully initiated, this is the URI that the user should be redirected to in order to continue processing the transaction.
\n ProcessURI\n.description: If the transaction was successfully initiated, this is the URI that the user should be redirected to in order to continue processing the transaction.

\n Success\n.value: Whether the transaction was initiated successfully or not.
\n Success\n.description: Whether the transaction was initiated successfully or not.

\n Token\n.value: The unique identifier for this transaction.
\n Token\n.description: The unique identifier for this transaction.

\n TransactionType\n.value: This indicates whether the transaction is for a StoreCardInfo or CardNotPresent request.
\n TransactionType\n.description: This indicates whether the transaction is for a StoreCardInfo or CardNotPresent request.

\n BBSPTransactionID\n.value: The unique identifier for this transaction in BBPS.
\n BBSPTransactionID\n.description: The unique identifier for this transaction in BBPS.

\n TransactionID\n.value: The unique identifier for this transaction.
\n TransactionID\n.description: The unique identifier for this transaction.

\n Approved\n.value: Approval status. Controls document's visibilty and access by others.
\n Approved\n.description: Approval status. Controls document's visibilty and access by others.

\n ContentMimeType\n.value: Standard mime-type name of uploaded document.
\n ContentMimeType\n.description: Standard mime-type name of uploaded document.

\n DocumentId\n.value: Unique id for this document in the system.
\n DocumentId\n.description: Unique id for this document in the system.

\n FileContents\n.value: Byte array of the uploaded document's contents
\n FileContents\n.description: Byte array of the uploaded document's contents

\n Filename\n.value: Original file name of uploaded document.
\n Filename\n.description: Original file name of uploaded document.

\n FileSizeBytes\n.value: File size of document and size of FileContents() byte array.
\n FileSizeBytes\n.description: File size of document and size of FileContents() byte array.

\n LibraryId\n.value: Id of Document Library containing this document.
\n LibraryId\n.description: Id of Document Library containing this document.

syntax.VB: Public FileTypes As Dictionary(Of String, String)

\n Description\n.value: User defined description of the Document part that created and manages this library.
\n Description\n.description: User defined description of the Document part that created and manages this library.

\n FileTypes\n.value: User defined list of file types to dictate what documents can be uploaded to this library, as determined in the designer of the Document part that created and manages this library.  Contains file extension and mime type.
\n FileTypes\n.description: User defined list of file types to dictate what documents can be uploaded to this library, as determined in the designer of the Document part that created and manages this library.  Contains file extension and mime type.

\n LibraryName\n.value: Name of the Document part that created and manages this library.
\n LibraryName\n.description: Name of the Document part that created and manages this library.

\n MaxSizeBytes\n.value: User defined maximum file size for documents in this library, as determined in the designer of the Document part that created and manages this library.
\n MaxSizeBytes\n.description: User defined maximum file size for documents in this library, as determined in the designer of the Document part that created and manages this library.

\n RequiresApproval\n.value: User defined approval rule for documents in this library, as determined in the designer of the Document part that created and manages this library.
\n RequiresApproval\n.description: User defined approval rule for documents in this library, as determined in the designer of the Document part that created and manages this library.

\n RestrictFileTypes\n.value: User defined rule for whether to restrict uploads to this library by the FileTypes list, as determined in the designer of the Document part that created and manages this library.
\n RestrictFileTypes\n.description: User defined rule for whether to restrict uploads to this library by the FileTypes list, as determined in the designer of the Document part that created and manages this library.

\n AddDocument\n.value: Add a document to an existing library.
\n AddDocument\n.description: Add a document to an existing library.

\n DeleteDocument\n.value: Permanantly removes a document from the site.
\n DeleteDocument\n.description: Permanantly removes a document from the site.

\n GetDocumentInfo\n.description: Retrieve the DocumentInfo object for a given document.

\n GetDocumentLibraryInfo.description: Get the API.Documents.DocumentLibraryInfo object of the Document Library associated with a given Document Part.

\n GetDocumentLibraryInfo.value: Get the API.Documents.DocumentLibraryInfo object of the specified Document Library. This direct approach does not require you have an associated content Part Id to retrieve the Library info, since document libraries may exist which are not explictly associating with a Documents Part.
\n GetDocumentLibraryInfo.description: Get the API.Documents.DocumentLibraryInfo object of the specified Document Library. This direct approach does not require you have an associated content Part Id to retrieve the Library info, since document libraries may exist which are not explictly associating with a Documents Part.

\n GetDocumentURL\n.value: Returns the URL for an uploaded document.
\n GetDocumentURL\n.description: Returns the URL for an uploaded document.

\n GetLibaryDocuments\n.value: Returns info on every Document in a given library associated with a Documents part.
\n GetLibaryDocuments\n.description: Returns info on every Document in a given library associated with a Documents part.

\n GetLibaryDocumentsDire.value: Returns info on every Document in a given library, accessing the library directly by its id. This direct approach does not require you have an associated content Part Id to retrieve the Library documents, since document libraries may exist which are not explictly associating with a Documents Part.
\n GetLibaryDocumentsDire.description: Returns info on every Document in a given library, accessing the library directly by its id. This direct approach does not require you have an associated content Part Id to retrieve the Library documents, since document libraries may exist which are not explictly associating with a Documents Part.

\n MarkTransactionAsProce.description: Marks a custom transaction as processed.

\n XMLDeserializeObject\n.description: Deserializes an XML object into the specified type.

\n CreditCardAuthorizatio.value:
The API will skip credit card processing if an authorization code and reference number are supplied 
 (for example if the caller has processed the card on its own and only wants to create a gift record in the back office).
\n CreditCardAuthorizatio.description:
The API will skip credit card processing if an authorization code and reference number are supplied 
 (for example if the caller has processed the card on its own and only wants to create a gift record in the back office).

\n CreditCardBBPSToken\n.value:
Optional. For recurring gifts, the API will get a card token from BBPS for future transactions, unless this value is already set.
 (for example if the caller has stored token with BBPS and only wants to create a gift record in the back office).
\n CreditCardBBPSToken\n.description:
Optional. For recurring gifts, the API will get a card token from BBPS for future transactions, unless this value is already set.
 (for example if the caller has stored token with BBPS and only wants to create a gift record in the back office).

\n CreditCardPassedLuhnVa.value:
If false, for recurring gifts not being charged on the current date, the API will validate the card number
 using the site's BBPS credentials.
 Set value to true if validation has already been performed and should be skipped.
 (for example if the caller has validated the card number and only wants to create a gift record in the back office).
\n CreditCardPassedLuhnVa.description:
If false, for recurring gifts not being charged on the current date, the API will validate the card number
 using the site's BBPS credentials.
 Set value to true if validation has already been performed and should be skipped.
 (for example if the caller has validated the card number and only wants to create a gift record in the back office).

\n CreditCardReferenceNum.value:
The API will skip credit card processing if an authorization code and reference number are supplied 
 (for example if the caller has processed the card on its own and only wants to create a gift record in the back office).
\n CreditCardReferenceNum.description:
The API will skip credit card processing if an authorization code and reference number are supplied 
 (for example if the caller has processed the card on its own and only wants to create a gift record in the back office).

\n DemoMode\n.value: If True, always returns approved from payment service.
\n DemoMode\n.description: If True, always returns approved from payment service.

\n SkipCardNumberValidati.value: If True, does not sanity check card number to card type.
\n SkipCardNumberValidati.description: If True, does not sanity check card number to card type.

\n SkipCreateGiftTransact.value: If True, API will simply process payment information and send an acknowledgement, skipping the creating of a back office gift record.
\n SkipCreateGiftTransact.description: If True, API will simply process payment information and send an acknowledgement, skipping the creating of a back office gift record.

\n CreatePaymentArgs\n.value:
Creates an argument object that can be passed to RecordDonation() method that is optionally pre-filled with the current user's
 biographical data. Provides a convenience for offering payment forms pre-loaded with current user's name and address.
\n CreatePaymentArgs\n.description:
Creates an argument object that can be passed to RecordDonation() method that is optionally pre-filled with the current user's
 biographical data. Provides a convenience for offering payment forms pre-loaded with current user's name and address.

\n GetProfileById\n.description: Get a constituent's profile data from The Raiser's Edge.

\n RecordDonation\n.description: Create a donation transaction that surfaces in The Raiser's Edge and eCRM

\n RecordProfileUpdate\n.description: Create a profile update transaction that surfaces in The Raiser's Edge and eCRM for updating constituent records.

\n IsInRole\n.value: Indicates whether the current user is a member of the specified role.
\n IsInRole\n.description: Indicates whether the current user is a member of the specified role.

\n LoginUser\n.value: Authenticates a CMS user using the supplied credentials.
\n LoginUser\n.description: Authenticates a CMS user using the supplied credentials.

\n RecordNewUser\n.value: Adds a new CMS user record.
\n RecordNewUser\n.description: Adds a new CMS user record.

\n UserIdAvailable\n.value: Indicates whether or not the requested CMS username is available.
\n UserIdAvailable\n.description: Indicates whether or not the requested CMS username is available.

\n AttributeItem\n.description: Returns the attribute item of specified record type and attribute type ID.
